pageContext.claim: “Almost 3.9 million Americans have been lifted off food stamps.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, 3.7 million people have stopped receiving food stamps since January 2017, according to the latest data. But experts say the improvement in the economy may not be the only reason for the decline. Most states have either no longer qualifiy for or have declined to apply for waivers that allowed some adults to keep their benefits for longer periods of time without employment. Moreover, the number of people collecting benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, formerly called food stamps, has been declining since fiscal year 2013. It had spiked because of the Great Recession but began declining under President Obama.
